title: URL Crashing browser. {Tested on firefox, Chrome and Safari}

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information_html:
Hi again Dear,

I am facing a strange behavior when I try to access this particular URL

https://hackerone.com/reports/10373

I test it on multiple computer with different browser.
Browser goes into indefinite loop and disabled right click ,and after some time it crashes .

It seems like the problem is because of JavaScript .
when I tried to debug it:

It looks like the JS function this creating problem

h.indexOf = function(e, t, n) {
if (null == e) return -1;
var r = 0,
i = e.length;
if (n) {
if ("number" != typeof n) return r = h.sortedIndex(e, t), e[r] === t ? r : -1;
r = 0 > n ? Math.max(0, i + n) : n
}
for (; i > r; r++)
if (e[r] === t) return r;
return -1
}

Please have a look and revert if I am wrong.

activities.message:
Hi @avicoder, thanks for your report! I can confirm the browser crash when visiting https://hackerone.com/reports/10373. But I'm not sure if we consider this as a security vulnerability. 

I'll keep you posted!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @avicoder, thanks for your report! I can confirm the browser crash when visiting https://hackerone.com/reports/10373. But I'm not sure if we consider this as a security vulnerability.

I'll keep you posted!

activities.message: Still, once I make person mind to click on that link , He won't be able to access Hackerone . even a separate link is opened in other tab. Don't you consider it as a Denial of service.

activities.message:
Hi @wvdv,

I've created a payload to exploit markdown parser.. 
You can find POC which I tested on report #39196 at @security.

I also attached the payload which I use  in comment or vulnerability report section. 

Please revert if needed further information.
Waiting for response .
:-)

activities.message:
Since you requested a status update on this report through #39196:

We're still working on fixing all the edge cases. The proof of concept you sent in might be fixed, but there are many other edge cases that can trigger the same slowdown effect. As a matter of fact, try typing in a long comment on your #39196 report and you'll see that it slows down the rate you type with exponentially.

activities.message:
We decided that this bug is ineligible for a bounty on the account that it doesn't meet the barrier of severeness.

The only possible attack vector here would be a researcher deliberately sending in reports that would crash the team's browser. In this scenario teams would still be able to close the report through bulk actions, making this more of a logical bug.

If you disagree with this decision and think that we might've missed something, please let me know!

Thanks again for taking the time to report this bug to us!
activities.markdown_message:
We decided that this bug is ineligible for a bounty on the account that it doesn't meet the barrier of severeness.

The only possible attack vector here would be a researcher deliberately sending in reports that would crash the team's browser. In this scenario teams would still be able to close the report through bulk actions, making this more of a logical bug.

If you disagree with this decision and think that we might've missed something, please let me know!

Thanks again for taking the time to report this bug to us!

activities.message: But still If user malformed input data is not properly handled and lead to crashing of browser  should be consider as security vulnerability.

activities.message:
Hello Dear,
I just wanted you to reconsider your decision for not giving bounty over this bug..

I have some points that I wanted to throw light on..
Here data which is posted , is only by a team member and only members of team can see it , so here  only team member could be  affected from this. But once the report is publicly available,  anyone can access that report. Now, once my payload is posted on a public report it could make hackerone inaccessible from any browser.

So please consider this bug as for publicly disclosed report which could have make big Denial of service..

activities.message:
Any website that elects to display arbitrary user-generated content accepts the risk of browser resource exhaustion. There are likely many more of these, especially in our markdown rendering and code formatting flows. You even stumbled across this one by accident (it was a legitimate content in #10373).

This a class of issue that doesn't represents a perpetual game of whack-a-mole. We'll fix the most egregious cases but our main defense is banning abusive users from the platform.

Sorry, but denial of service issues (especially client resource exhaustion) are commonly ineligible in bounty programs.
